answerText: Evangeline, A Tale of Acadie[10] Evangeline is by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, who wrote a poem about this character, the son of Nokomis, who slays Pearl-Feather and falls in love with Minnehaha.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Yale A + Minnesota A | 1 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poem is unusual among English-language poetry for using the classical meter of dactylic hexameter. For 10 points each:  [10] Name this 1847 poem in which the title Acadian lass searches for her love Gabriel Lajeunesse after being deported. It opens with a line beginning "This is the forest primeval".
